references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of active learning, introducing the concept of using queries to efficiently learn concepts.
This paper addresses a crucial challenge in active learning by establishing the theoretical foundations for learning under noisy labels.
This paper introduces the concept of margin-based active learning, a powerful technique that leverages the margin of classifiers to improve query efficiency.
This paper tackles the challenge of noise in active learning and introduces methods for robust interactive learning to improve the algorithm's performance.
This paper provides a comprehensive theoretical framework for disagreement-based active learning, a popular approach with strong theoretical guarantees.
